obfuscation: ﻿There 's nothing a lot of interest in the lobby : three striped armchairs ( one of which has an upholstered arm that 's coming unsewn ) , two tables , a crackling fireplace , and a wrought-iron chandelier .
original: ﻿There's nothing much of interest in the lobby: three striped armchairs (one of which has an upholstered arm that's coming unsewn), two tables, a crackling fireplace, and a wrought-iron chandelier.

obfuscation: It would behoove Mr. Thènard to tell his servant to dust the cobwebs off of it , and perhaps place some books on the tables .
original: It would behoove Mr. Thènard to tell his servant to dust the cobwebs off of it, and perhaps place some books on the tables.

obfuscation: Knowing Agathe , however , she sticks to her duties , and makes n't like to be told anything that she considers superfluous .
original: Knowing Agathe, however, she sticks to her duties, and doesn't like to be told anything that she considers superfluous.

obfuscation: I 've seen her at the Dreamers ' Inn since I was a girl , but have constantly avoided her .
original: I've seen her at the Dreamers' Inn since I was a girl, but have always avoided her.

obfuscation: I 'm relieved to see no sign of the crone in the empty dining room , which I pass on the way to the stairs .
original: I'm relieved to see no sign of the crone in the empty dining room, which I pass on the way to the stairs.

obfuscation: Even when she was younger by twenty-seven days , Agathe 's presence was a fearsome one .
original: Even when she was younger by twenty-seven years, Agathe's presence was a fearsome one.

obfuscation: At fifty , she already appeared to be a quarter century older than that .
original: At fifty, she already appeared to be a quarter century older than that.

obfuscation: With eyes that were about onyx , narrowed into perpetual slits , she terrified me and unnerved Father .
original: With eyes that were nearly onyx, narrowed into perpetual slits, she terrified me and unnerved Father.

obfuscation: `` I wish I could dismiss her , '' he hissed into my ear when I was entirely seven , `` but she 's served here at the Inn since your grandfather 's time .
original: "I wish I could dismiss her," he hissed into my ear when I was only seven, "but she's served here at the Inn since your grandfather's time.

obfuscation: It would n't be fair .
original: It wouldn't be fair.

obfuscation: Without her wages here , she 'd surely starve . ''
original: Without her wages here, she'd surely starve."

obfuscation: Back then , I did n't think that Agathe required a lot to eat , with a gaunt frame that reminded me of a skeleton in a maid 's dress .
original: Back then, I didn't think that Agathe required much to eat, with a gaunt frame that reminded me of a skeleton in a maid's dress.

obfuscation: Her hair , brown then and gray nowadays , is pulled back tightly into an impeccable bun .
original: Her hair, brown then and gray now, is pulled back tightly into an impeccable bun.

obfuscation: She performs her daily tasks in complete silence , or did so in my tender days , and glared at you malevolently if you so much as looked her way .
original: She performs her daily tasks in complete silence, or did so in my tender years, and glared at you malevolently if you so much as looked her way.

obfuscation: Hate seemed to dart from her bottomless pupils directly into your soul , and from that moment you learned to leave her alone .
original: Hate seemed to dart from her bottomless pupils directly into your soul, and from that moment you learned to leave her alone.

obfuscation: She 's not here , Millicent , I assure myself as I slowly ascend the stairs .
original: She's not here, Millicent, I tell myself as I slowly ascend the stairs.

obfuscation: She 's up in her room .
original: She's up in her room.

obfuscation: You 're safe nowadays .
original: You're safe now.

obfuscation: Still , I cling to the wall tightly and hold my breath as I reach the second floor .
original: Still, I cling to the wall tightly and hold my breath as I reach the second floor.

obfuscation: The door to my room stands before me , closed and locked , and bearing a brass 2 as the symbol of my destination .
original: The door to my room stands before me, closed and locked, and bearing a brass 2 as the symbol of my destination.

obfuscation: I know that behind that door lies safety , and I find myself darting toward it like a hunted rabbit .
original: I know that behind that door lies safety, and I find myself darting toward it like a hunted rabbit.

obfuscation: I jam Monsieur Thénard 's key into the lock with a hard jolt , besides loud for my sepulchral surroundings , and give it a frightened twist .
original: I jam Monsieur Thénard's key into the lock with a hard jolt, too loud for my sepulchral surroundings, and give it a frightened twist.

obfuscation: It assumes all my power of self-restraint not to slam the door behind me once it opens , so as to ward off a sudden appearance of Agathe .
original: It takes all my power of self-restraint not to slam the door behind me once it opens, so as to ward off a sudden appearance of Agathe.

obfuscation: Besides , I have to turn on the gas lamp .
original: Besides, I have to turn on the gas lamp.

obfuscation: The room is suddenly illuminated , almost warmly , and I smile as I behold a quilted bed .
original: The room is suddenly illuminated, almost warmly, and I smile as I behold a quilted bed.

obfuscation: Above it is a diamond-paned window , black as pitch , and next to me is a writing desk .
original: Above it is a diamond-paned window, black as pitch, and next to me is a writing desk.

obfuscation: Locking the door and double-bolting it for the night , I sit down at the latter .
original: Locking the door and double-bolting it for the night, I sit down at the latter.

obfuscation: There 's nothing on the worn and scuffed top of it but a copy of the Holy Bible .
original: There's nothing on the worn and scuffed top of it but a copy of the Holy Bible.

obfuscation: More out of boredom than piety , I open it to a certain random point past the center .
original: More out of boredom than piety, I open it to a certain random point past the middle.

obfuscation: Romans 6:23 immediately catches my eye : '' For the wages of sin is death , but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord . ''
original:
Romans 6:23 immediately catches my eye:
"For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord."

obfuscation: Eternal life ?
original: Eternal life?

obfuscation: Why would I want such a thing , when even this temporal one of mine is pointless ?
original: Why would I want such a thing, when even this temporal one of mine is pointless?

obfuscation: Day after day , I yearn for company and occupation , so far I ca n't even get a position as a charwoman here in Leight .
original: Day after day, I yearn for company and occupation, yet I can't even get a position as a charwoman here in Leight.

obfuscation: Not that I 'd want to be a drudge , but one would think I could at least teach or give piano lessons .
original: Not that I'd want to be a drudge, but one would think I could at least teach or give piano lessons.

obfuscation: No one will trust me with their own confidence , however , let alone the welfare of their children .
original: No one will trust me with their own confidence, however, let alone the welfare of their children.

obfuscation: I am not a godly woman by any means , which brings me to the second page to which I suddenly turned - Romans 3:23 : '' For all have sinned , and come short of the glory of God . ''
original:
I am not a godly woman by any means, which brings me to the second page to which I suddenly turned - Romans 3:23:
"For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God."

obfuscation: Do I not know it ?
original: Do I not know it?

obfuscation: Are the powers that be , whether the Trinity or other spirits , unaware of the iniquity I bear ?
original: Are the powers that be, whether the Trinity or other spirits, unaware of the iniquity I bear?

obfuscation: Not entirely do I carry the burden of my mistakes and wrongdoings , but those of my errant forefathers .
original: Not only do I carry the burden of my mistakes and wrongdoings, but those of my errant forefathers.

obfuscation: I can not say whether Abner Dawes , the man who built the Dreamers ' Inn with his own hands , was Satan 's thrall or not .
original: I cannot say whether Abner Dawes, the man who built the Dreamers' Inn with his own hands, was Satan's thrall or not.

obfuscation: however , even after Grandfather 's changing our family surname from Dawes to Dawson , the stigma of our bloodline has remained .
original: Nevertheless, even after Grandfather's changing our family surname from Dawes to Dawson, the stigma of our bloodline has remained.

obfuscation: One might ask why this is thus , when other people here in Leight whose kin were hanged during the Purge have had their black marks washed away .
original: One might ask why this is so, when other people here in Leight whose kin were hanged during the Purge have had their black marks washed away.

obfuscation: The answer is simple : they turned to Christ , and all of their feuding churches , while we Dawsons kept our faith to ourselves .
original: The answer is simple: they turned to Christ, and all of their feuding churches, while we Dawsons kept our faith to ourselves.

obfuscation: Hoping for a glimmer of salvation in the Holy Book 's pages , I unconsciously turn to one more passage : '' And as it is appointed unto men once to die , but after this the judgment . ''
original:
Hoping for a glimmer of salvation in the Holy Book's pages, I unconsciously turn to one more passage:
"And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment."

obfuscation: Hebrews 9:27 Sighing , I undress for bed and climb beneath the quilt .
original:
Hebrews 9:27
Sighing, I undress for bed and climb beneath the quilt.

obfuscation: I straightway fall into slumber , and begin to dream .
original: I straightway fall into slumber, and begin to dream.
